NEW YORK STATE EDUCATIONAL RADIO AND TELEVISION ASSOCIATION, INCORPORATED
PREAMBLE
We believe that radio and television are important factors and
influences in our lives* As individuals and as representatives of
educational and cultural institutions and organizations engaged in
education by radio and television, we associate so that the benefits
of non-commercial educational radio and television may be extended
throughout New York State.
ARTICLE I
The name of this corporation shall be New York State Educational
Radio and Television Association, Inc. (herein after referred to as the
Association.)
ARTICLE II
PURFOSE
To help extend the benefits of educational radio and television
throughout New York State.
To help maintain high professional standards of educational radio
and television.
To foster the development, utilization, and acceptance of educational
radio and television in New York State.
To encourage the operation of non-commercial radio and television
stations and networks, and the presentation of non-commercial educational
programs on commercial stations.
ARTICLE III
MEMBERSHIP
The membership of the New York State Educational Radio and Television
Association shall be classified as follows:
SECTION A: Active Membership: Any university, college, school system
or other organization engaging in non-commercial educational broadÂ¬
casting or closed circuit educational radio or television operations
may be an ACTIVE member and shall be entitled to two (2) votes each
on all matters of business brought before the membership.
